title: BGT: The Champions act says Ant and Dec were exhausted after filming series in a week
text:
The pre-recorded series of Britain's Got Talent: The Champions is set to come to a close on Saturday.

And ahead of the grand finale, contestant Richard Jones has revealed that Ant and Dec had been left exhausted and desperate for sleep after the entire ITV series was filmed over the course of just one week.

Though magician Richard, 29, didn't make it to the final night, he did divulge the inner workings of the hit show, revealing that filming was tough on the host and the rest of the BGT team.

Reveal: Contestant Richard Jones has revealed that Ant and Dec had been left exhausted and desperate for sleep after the entire ITV series was filmed over the course of just one week

Speaking to the Sun Online, the former Britain's Got Talent winner explained: 'It was all in one week. I think it was Wednesday to Tuesday.'

He then told how the Geordie duo, as well as judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams barely had some time for some shut eye as they were filming episodes back to back.

He continued: 'The Britain's Got Talent team are amazing. I don't know how they do it but they hardly sleep at all in that week because they're so busy.'

Heaping praise on the stars as well as the production and crew who work tirelessly to put the show together, Richard added: 'But they're always on form, always lovely and they're a really switched-on team. I don't know how they manage it.'

Tough schedule: Though magician Richard, 29, didn't make it to the final night, he did divulge the inner workings of the hit show, revealing that filming was tough on the host and the rest of the BGT team

The magician also went on to state that competitors had to be very prepared as the shows had 'a quick turnaround'.

He added that acts had to ensure that they had their final performances 'prepared' due to the tight filming schedule.

Meanwhile, judge David Walliams came under fire last month for not pressing his golden buzzer for Richard.

The soldier left everyone in tears as he paid tribute to late war veteran Fergus Anckorn, but it wasn't enough for David to reach for his golden buzzer.

Praise: 'The Britain's Got Talent team are amazing. I don't know how they do it but they hardly sleep at all in that week because they're so busy'

Applause: 'They're always on form, always lovely and they're a really switched-on team. I don't know how they manage it'

Shattered: He told how the Geordie duo, as well as judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams barely had some time for some shut eye as they were filming episodes back to back

Taking to Twitter, many felt that David should have pressed his buzzer for Richard and in not doing so, Richard is now out of the competition.

'It’s all your fault David Richard was so much better than the old dancer. Should have been Richard and Darcy. #Endoff', fumed one angry watcher.

While another wrote: '@richjonesmagic you should've won infact you should've got the golden buzzer #Respect #BGT.'

Backlash: Judge David Walliams came under fire last month for not pressing his golden buzzer for Richard

A third unimpressed person added: 'David messed up, sorry to say it but he did, but well done to all the winner #BGT.'

'What the hell is that result! Richard should be through! What rubbish! #BGTTheChampions #BGT,' raged another.

With an additional BGT viewer seething: 'David you idiot - everyone said you should have pressed the buzzer for Richard now HES GONE #bgt.'

Britian's Got Talent: The Champions concludes Saturday at 8.30pm on ITV.
